results.title: La Mama
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: on stage”.
Betty Burstall founded La Mama in Carlton, Melbourne, in 1967 as a venue for experimental theatre. During her nine years as Artistic Director, she encouraged playwrights, poets, actors and musicians to reject theatrical traditions and push the boundaries of performing art. La Mama is synonymous with the renaissance of Australian theatre. Playwrights such as Williamson, Buzo, Dickins, Romeril and Hibberd wrote about contemporary Australia. Actors rejected the formality of conventional theatre and developed a larrikin performance style which reflected a new awareness of cultural identity. In this engaging compilation film, Burstall, her successor Liz Jones, writers Barry Dickins and Jack Hibberd and performers Petter Cummins and Valerie Kirwin speak to Mary-Lou Jelbart about the challenges and joys of working at La Mama.

results.title: Transmission, drive shaft and differential
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”
An explanation of the transmission, drive shaft and differential, indicating maintenance methods to be adopted.

results.title: Periodic check-up
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
The necessary steps in the periodic check-up of a car. Including the brake system, inspecting the steering systems and inspecting chasses and body.

results.title: Clutch and handbrake
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to determine and correct the amount of clutch pedal clearance or “lash”, check clutch for slipping, grabbing or drag; how to inspect and adjust the hand brake.

results.title: Steering, wheels, front and rear axles
results.creator_credit: United States. Army. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to check for play in the steering wheel and the front end assembly; correct wheel run-out; make a test; test springs, axles and overall back-lash.

results.title: Introduction to preventive maintenance
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
Shows the importance of preventive maintenance in truck operation and illustrates a typical preventive maintenance check as applied to the clutch pedal, the battery and the voltage regulator.

results.title: Know your car
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Jam Handy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
An instructional training film for students or drivers, presenting a simple exposiiton of the physical principles and mechanics of a car - suspension, steering, fuel combustion, clutch, gears, brakes etc.

results.title: Training men for the atomic age
results.creator_credit: Hearst Metrotone and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Atoms for Peace”
The training program in nuclear physics for foreign scientists sponsored by the US Atomic Energy Commission. Shows activities at the University of Pennsylvania, Oak Ridge Institute of Nuclear Studies, International School of Nuclear Science and Engineering at La Grange, Illinois, and construction of a nuclear reactor at Shippingport, Pennsylvania.
